meanings.definition: Show or prove to be right or reasonable.
meanings.sent1: She tried justifying her actions by explaining the reasons behind them.
meanings.sent2: He was justifying his decision based on the evidence presented.
meanings.sent3: The detective was justifying his theory with a quirky dance to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was justifying her happiness more than any words could.
meanings.sent5: The colorful charts were justifying the data in a visually appealing way.

meanings.definition: Declare or make righteous in the sight of God.
meanings.sent1: The priest was justifying the repentant sinner in front of the congregation.
meanings.sent2: The religious leader was justifying the faithful through prayers and blessings.
meanings.sent3: The angel was justifying the mischievous child's actions with a gentle smile.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight streaming through the stained glass was justifying the sacred space.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful hymns were justifying the solemn atmosphere of the church.

meanings.definition: Adjust the spacing between words in a line to fill it out to the full measure.
meanings.sent1: The typesetter was justifying the text to make it look more balanced on the page.
meanings.sent2: The editor was justifying the document to ensure it met the formatting requirements.
meanings.sent3: The printer was justifying the words on the page with precision and care.
meanings.sent4: The designer was justifying the text to create a visually appealing layout.
meanings.sent5: The writer was justifying the spacing to enhance the readability of the text.
